thread.title: Ground News - Reporter lashes out after blowback for claiming 'Christian nationalists' believe rights 'come from God'
thread.title_full: Ground News - Reporter lashes out after blowback for claiming 'Christian nationalists' believe rights 'come from God'

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Reporter lashes out after blowback for claiming 'Christian nationalists' believe rights 'come from God'
text: Reporter lashes out after blowback for claiming 'Christian nationalists' believe rights 'come from God' - Believers in Christian nationalism argue that rights do not stem from earthly authorities but from God. - A commentator asserts that those who believe in rights given by God are Christian nationalists, not simply Christians. - Christian nationalists, though diverse, are united in the belief that rights are God-given. 7 Articles 7 Articles [The Daily Caller 3 hours ago·Washington, United StatesRead Full Article] Reporter Roasted After Claiming Only ‘Extremist’ Christian Nationalists Think Rights ‘Come From God’ Politico's Heidi Przybyla got roasted over social media Friday for saying Christian nationalists in power believe Americans' rights "come from God." [The Blaze 47 minutes ago·United StatesRead Full Article] Reporter goes viral for attacking Christians who believe rights come from God — and the responses are glorious Politico reporter Heidi Przybyla claimed on Thursday that Christians who believe rights are derived from God are "Christian nationalists."Speaking on MSNBC, Przybyla claimed that former President Donald Trump is surrounding himself with an "extremist element" of Christians, whom she identified as "C... [NewsBusters 4 hours ago·Washington, United StatesRead Full Article] Civics Illiterate: Politico Reporter Denies Our Rights Come from God Someone failed their high school civics class! Or at least that’s the impression Politico’s democracy investigator, Heidi Przybyla left during an appearance on MSNBC’s All In Thursday night. According to the reporter who’s supposedly brushed up on American governance, if you understood that your rights as a human came from a higher power, it made up part of a dangerous “extremist element” in American politics. She even rhetorically scoffed that … [Independent Journal Review 7 hours agoRead Full Article] Commentary: MSNBC Guest Suggests ‘Christian Nationalists’ Are United By a Belief Rights Come From God -- Gets Dragged An MSNBC guest is getting absolutely dragged on social media after she said a main view of so-called Christian nationalism is a belief that our rights come from God. During an appearance on MSNBC, Politico’s Heidi Przybyla said, “The one thing that unites all of them — because there’s many different groups orbiting Trump — but the thing that unites them as Christian nationalists — not Christians by the way because Christian nationalists [are] ve… [Fox News 3 hours ago·New York, United StatesRead Full Article] Reporter lashes out after blowback for claiming 'Christian nationalists' believe rights 'come from God' Politico's Heidi Przybyla went viral for comments she made on MSNBC bashing "Christian nationalists," with critics accusing her of denigrating people of faith.
